It is all there for you, but it is not necessarily happening to you.

post.title: June 8
post.body:
Stay with the seeing, and not with the believing.
It is this open-ness that brings the energy to the fore; the seeming eternal energy that spreads like a flame throughout humanity.

post.title: June 7
post.body:
Liberation is not really a loss of belief, but a loss of the believer.
It is the loss of everything.

post.title: June 6
post.body: Relationship is a constant, moving, living thing.

post.title: June 5
post.body: If you think relationship differs from person to person, then what you describe is not relationship, but your own prejudice and preference based on memory.

post.title: June 4
post.body:
Can't you just look at the tree?
Don't worry over this word is not the thing nonsense. Just look.
Embrace its beauty.

post.title: June 3
post.body: Whatever you think of liberation — how to get, how to acquire — is irrelevant, and will only keep you from expressing whatever is naturally within you.

post.title: June 2
post.body:
The seeds of peace are within you.
You do not have to be a farmer to nurture those seeds, or to cultivate a life to unimaginable heights.

post.title: June 1
post.body:
The lessons of Nature are constantly available, forever playing out in front of you.
Only for you.

post.title: June
post.body: ![June](data/img/june.jpg "June")

post.title: May 31
post.body:
Freedom, liberation, truth, is really the most fragile thing.
It can be destroyed with a word, an image, an idea.

post.title: May 30
post.body:
Perhaps aggressive acts will come to an end because humanity will finally see the danger and act accordingly.
Perhaps aggressive acts will come to an end due to the extinction of humanity.
Does one seem more likely than the other?

post.title: May 29
post.body:
There is no world crisis, meaning, out of your hands. It is your crisis.
It is not your fault, but it is your responsibility.

post.title: May 28
post.body:
One can only pity the self.
All the activity it undertakes in order to find something it can never know.

post.title: May 27
post.body:
Stop.
Take your time.
Breathe…

post.title: May 26
post.body: Effort is separation.

post.title: May 25
post.body:
The searcher might get caught up in what they think is there, or what they think might happen.
But these very ideas of what may or may not be, solidify the problem even more.

post.title: May 24
post.body:
You have seen this clearly.
With every perception, you become the greatest teacher you’ll ever need.

post.title: May 23
post.body:
If there is an age of enlightenment, it is now. It has always been now.
It is within every moment of every second, in every petal of every flower, and it is inescapable.

post.title: May 22
post.body: Experience is a solidified and unchanging state, born from a unique and ever changing moment.

post.title: May 21
post.body: If you want to investigate, begin with your own beliefs.

post.title: May 20
post.body:
The should be is not a fact; the wanting to be is.
All of this begins with what we have, as painful as it may be.

post.title: May 19
post.body:
All that you are searching for is hidden within your own being.
You are your own greatest guru.

post.title: May 18
post.body:
It is life, as it is lived.
It is not anything more or less than that.

post.title: May 17
post.body: Compassion is expressed when the idea of being compassionate is dropped.

post.title: May 16
post.body: Every movement in liberation becomes an expression of compassion and love.

post.title: May 15
post.body: How do you know what an enlightened person is supposed to look like?

post.title: May 14
post.body: When our objections arise, it is the perfect moment to see how we, the identity of self, operate; how we may react to things we believe or disbelieve.

post.title: May 13
post.body: When the self is in action, it is a movement of the past.

post.title: May 12
post.body: As there is no self to define, definitions are useless.

post.title: May 11
post.body: Understanding is never enough.

post.title: May 10
post.body: All the time you are becoming, you are never being.

post.title: May 9
post.body:
Nature can only be.
You are nature.

post.title: May 8
post.body:
There may be pride in knowing liberation. There may even be the need to tell everyone what you now believe.
But is the stillness there? Or did the monkey simply take the train down a different track?

post.title: May 7
post.body:
If you are full of beliefs, there is nothing wrong with that.
But if you want to deeply inquire within, be prepared to lose everything.

post.title: May 6
post.body:
Sit with yourself, with no expectation of what you will get or how long it will take.
Do it for the sake of the doing, and nothing else.

post.title: May 5
post.body:
Can one make love happen?
Is it something we have some control over, or is making love happen the same as making breathing happen?

post.title: May 4
post.body:
Be considerate, but please don't worry too much about being on time.
You'll be dead soon, in the scheme of things, and I am fairly certain your final thoughts will not linger over someone's anger at your tardiness.

post.title: May 3
post.body: Learn deeply the lives of those you love. It is a lesson beyond measure.

post.title: May 2
post.body:
How many pages, in the book of your life, have been written by others?
Most of them? All of them?
What is it you hope to achieve by editing the words of others?

post.title: May 1
post.body:
You will lose everything you hold dear.
But that is quite all right; you have nothing to begin with.

post.title: May
post.body: ![May](data/img/may.jpg "May")

post.title: April 30
post.body: Using words, all one can do is approach the essence.

post.title: April 29
post.body:
The only mystery is the one you have created.
Outside of your ideas, where does it exist?

post.title: April 28
post.body: Never once can there be the knowledge of what is not, and if there is a knowing of the not, it is not the not.

post.title: April 27
post.body:
Sit down with one of your closest friends.
How do you see them? Can you see without your memories?

post.title: April 26
post.body: Is the I trapped, or is the I the trap?

post.title: April 25
post.body:
Cast out all of it and begin where you are.
You do not need anyone to tell you what is there.

post.title: April 24
post.body: The problem is your story of liberation; the idea of what is there and how joyful you will be once you achieve it.

post.title: April 23
post.body: Instead of a frightened, uncertain, violent caveman with a pointy stick, we have a frightened, uncertain, violent caveman with gun and a home theater system.

post.title: April 22
post.body:
Another person might explain liberation, or how it will unfold, beautifully.
But that doesn’t mean anything.
Even though they may very well end up being correct, it still means nothing.

post.title: April 21
post.body:
It is destruction…
…leaving nothing but dust.

post.title: April 20
post.body: The questioner is the answer.

post.title: April 19
post.body: The greatest freedom comes from what the human being can explore on its own, outside of the external powers that be.

post.title: April 18
post.body: Compassion is, where separation is not.

post.title: April 17
post.body:
Is it possible to be compassionate, or is there just compassion?
This is very important to understand on your own.

post.title: April 16
post.body: All movement in liberation is an extension of compassion.

post.title: April 15
post.body:
People think of enlightenment in terms of how it should be.
And if, after all of this time, you are still only seeing what you think should be, what is the point of it all?
Once you follow the should, you are lost.

post.title: April 14
post.body:
Preconceived ideas of right and wrong compress the organism into a dull zombified way of seeing.
It is not really seeing at all, but a dependence upon our preferences of right and wrong.

post.title: April 13
post.body: If there is a who contemplating, the who and the item of contemplation are the same.

post.title: April 12
post.body:
Everything just happens.
Nothing ever happens.

post.title: April 11
post.body:
It is true that all we need is food and shelter.
But there is no need to live in a cave or give away everything we own.
An ascetic lifestyle is just a different kind of greed.

post.title: April 10
post.body:
I go to you for the answer to enlightenment.
You tell me, _Do this, do that_.
I do those things, but nothing changes.
I go on and on.

post.title: April 9
post.body: If there is separation, it is due to the activity of thought, and has nothing to do with what you really are.

post.title: April 8
post.body: Liberation is beyond all of your ideas of Liberation.

post.title: April 7
post.body:
Oneness isn’t a matter of believing in non-belief.
There simply is no belief.

post.title: April 6
post.body:
Being alone has nothing to do with loneliness. And it is not about isolation.
Only the self can be isolated, and this isolation has nothing to do with one’s surroundings.

post.title: April 5
post.body: You are the only one. There are no others.

post.title: April 4
post.body:
The wind blows.
Bits of trash scrape along the street.
That is all there is.

post.title: April 3
post.body:
The world needs you.
Somewhere on this planet are men, women, children — real-life human beings — that will benefit from your presence.
Please, do not waste one more minute of time.
You will be dead soon, after all.

post.title: April 2
post.body:
If you draw a picture of yourself, make it as detailed as possible with the exception of the eyes.
Leave them out entirely.
This is a more accurate depiction of how we live our lives.

post.title: April 1
post.body: Dualism of the word enslaves you to the emptiness of thought, which is not the emptiness of being.

post.title: April
post.body: ![April](data/img/april.jpg "April")

post.title: March 31
post.body:
A guru may tell us Enlightenment is all bliss, all love, all this or all that.
And all we can do is imagine that non-existent state.
Then we begin our search, looking for the state we have imagined, which is not the actual thing.

post.title: March 30
post.body: Grass bends in the wind, but not because it wants to bend.

post.title: March 29
post.body:
None of this is a mystery.
Always as it is; never as it should be.

post.title: March 28
post.body:
There is no security in the self.
There is no security in Liberation.

post.title: March 27
post.body: To relate is to be present, to be fresh, from beginning to end.

post.title: March 26
post.body: Is there a Way of Seeing that is not dependent upon the known?

post.title: March 25
post.body:
This thing takes hold instantly,
and there is no way to see how anything could have led to it.

post.title: March 24
post.body: You cannot flower under the boot of another.

post.title: March 23
post.body: Freedom will not come through accumulation.

post.title: March 22
post.body:
Technology allows us to be connected instantly all over the world.
Yet, we are the loneliest we have ever been.

post.title: March 21
post.body: The selfish always fall, and fall hard.

post.title: March 20
post.body: Are you able to listen?

post.title: March 19
post.body:
People want to be free from suffering.
But their favored means of attainment is personified suffering.

post.title: March 18
post.body: This is not mere understanding.

post.title: March 17
post.body: Compassion is a natural movement, not dependent upon thought.
